title: The “False Consensus Effect”: An Egocentric Bias in Social Perception and Attribution Processes

steps: Participants are presented with a brief story describing a hypothetical situation, a personal description item, or a behavioral request.
Participants indicate their own behavioral choice, preference, or self-categorization.
Participants estimate the percentage of their peers (or 'college students in general') who would choose each available option or fall into each category.
Participants rate a 'typical' person who would make either choice on a set of specified personality traits (applicable to Study 1 and Study 3).
